chapter.name: Preamble
chapter.article:
This Protocol establishes the conditions, modalities and rates of achievement of the transitional stage referred to in article 4. of the agreement establishing
an association between the European Economic Community and Turkey. FREE MOVEMENT OF GOODS

1. The provisions of Chapter I, Section I and of Chapter II of this part shall apply:
(a) to goods produced in the Community or in Turkey, including those manufactured wholly or partly from products coming from third countries which are given free pratique in the Community or in Turkey;
(b) to goods coming from third countries which are given free pratique in the Community or in Turkey.
2. Goods given free pratique in the Commnity or in Turkey shall be deemed to be products coming from third countries in respect of which the necessary import formalities have been completed and the appropriate customs duties or charges of equivalent effect have been levied in the Community or in Turkey, and which have not benefited by any total or partial drawback on such duties or charges.
3. Goods imported from thirds countries into the Community or in Turkey under special customs treatment by reason of their origin or their provenance may not be deemed to be in free pratique when they. are re-exported to the other Contracting Party. However, the Association Council may, grant waivers from this rule in the
conditions determined by it.
4. The provisions of articles 1 and 2 shall apply only to goods exported by the Community or by-Turkey as from the date of signature of this Protocol.

1. The provisions of Chapter I, Section I and Chapter II of this Part shall apply
likewise to goods obtained in the Community or in Turkey, for whose manufacture products have been used which come from third countries and were not given free pratique in either the Community or in Turkey. Admission of the said goods under
these provisions shall, however, be subject in the exporting State to a compensatory levy charged at a rate equal to a percentage of the Common Customs Tariff duties applicable to the products from third countries used in their manufacture. The said percentage, which shall be fixed by the associationon Council for each period as it may determine, shall be based on the tariff reduction granted to the goods in the importing State. The Association Council shall likewise determine the procedures for collecting the compensatory levy, taking into account the rules in force on the subject prior to l July 1363 in trade between the member States
2. However, the compensatory levy shall not be charged upon the export to the Community or to Turkey of goods obtained in the conditions referred to in this Article so long as for the majority of goods imported into the other Contracting Party, the rate of the customs duty reduction does not exceed 20 per cent, taking into account the various rates of tariff reduction established under this Protocol.

The Association Council shall define the methods of administrative co-operation
to be followed in implementing Articles2 and 3, taking into account the methods
decided on br the Community in respect of trade in goods between the member States.

1. Any Contractign Party which considers that disparities resulting from the application to imports of either customs duties or quantitative restrictions, or
any measures with equivalent effect, or of any other trade policy measure, threaten to divert trade or create economic difficulties on its territory, may bring *the matter to the notice of the associationn Council which shall, if necessary, recommend suitable measures for avoiding any losses which may ensue.
2. If diversions of trade or economic difficulties arise and the Party concerned considers that they call for immediate action, it may itself take the necessary measures of protection and notify them without dela, to the association Council which may decide whether they must be modified or abolished.
3. Priority of choice should be given to measures which cause the least distur bance in the functioning of the Association and in particular in the normal development of trade.

During the transitional stage, the Contracting Parties shall, to the extent
requisite for the proper functioning of the Association, take steps to approximately their customs laws, regulations and administrative rules, taking into account the approximations already effected by the States members of the Community.

chapter.name: Customs Union
chapter.article:
1. The Contracting Parties shall refrain from introducing as between themselves new customs duties or charges with equivalent effect on imports and exports and
from raising such duties as they apply in their trade relations with one another as from the date of entry into force of this Protocol.
26 Nevertheless, the associationn Council may authorize the Contracting Parties
to introduce new customs duties or charges with equivalent effect on exports if necessary for the attainment of the objectives of the 'greement.
Customs duties on imports and charges with equivalent effect in force between the Community and Turkey shall be gradually abolished under the conditions laid down in articles 9 to 11.
As from the entry into force of this Protocol, the Community shall abolish the customs duties and charges with equivalent effect applicable to imports from Turkey.

1. In the case of each product, the basic duty on which the successive reductions are to be made by Turkey, shall be the duty effectively applied towards the Community on the date of signature of this Protocol.
2. The time-table of the reductions to be made by Turkey shall be fixed as follows: the first reduction, shall be made on the entry into force of this Protocol; the. second and third reductions respectively three years and five years later; the fourth and subsequent reductionss shall be effected each year, so that the last reduction is effected at the end of the transition period.
3. bach reduction shall be made by reducing the basic duty on each, product by 10 per cent.

Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 10, paragraphs 2 and 3 Turkey shall
gradually eliminate the basic duties towards the Community over a period of twenty- two years for the products included in annex 3, as follows: a 5 per cent reduction on each duty shall be made on the entry into force of this Protocol. Three further reductions of 5 per cent each shall be made respectively, three, six and ten years later.
Eight further reductions of 10 per cent each shall be made respectively twelve, thirteen, fifteen, seventeen, eighteen, twenty, twenty-one and twenty-two years after the entry into force of this Protocol.

1. With a view to protecting the development of a new processing industry not
existing in Turkey on the entry into force of this Protocol, or to ensuring the expansion of an existing processing industry, as provided for in the Turkish development plan in course of implementation at the moment considered, Turkey may make the necessary amendments to Annex 3 during the first eight years of the transitional stage, provided:
-that the general body of these amendments does not affect a total value of imports, calculated on the basis of the figures for 1967, exceeding 10 per cent of imports from the Community during that same year:
that the total value of imports from the Community of all the products
included in annex 3, taken together and still calculated on the basis of
the figures for 1067, is not increased,
The products added to Annex 3 may be immediately subjected to the duties
calculated according to the provisions of Article 11; those to which these duties are not applicable shall immediately be subject to the duties calculated according to the provisions of article 10.
2. Turkey shall notify the Association Council of the measures it intends to take in accordance with the above provisions.
3. With a view to the objective mentioned in paragraph 1 above and within the
limit of 10 per cent of imports from the Community during 1967, the associationon Council may authorize Turkey, during the transitional stage, to reintroduce, increase or establish import customs duties on products subject to the treatment, provided for in .rticle 10.
These tariff measures may not, as regards each of the items they affect, raise the duties applied to imports from the Community to a, level higher than 25 per cent ad valorem.
4. The iAssociation Council may authorize departures from the provisions of paragraphs 1 and 3.

1. Irrespective of the provisions. of Articles 9 to 11, the Contracting Parties may suspend, wholly or in part, the levying of the duties applied to products imported from the other Party, the latter to be duly informed thereof, in particular -so far as Turkey is concerned -with a view to facilitating imports of certain products needed for promoting its economic development.
2. The Contracting Parties declare their readiness to lower their customs
duties towards each other at a faster rate than that laid down in Articles9 to 11, if their general economic situation and the situation of the sector concerned so permit.. The Association Council shall make recommendations to this affect.

In the event that Turkey eliminates a charge with equivalent effect to customs
duties vis-à-vis a third country at a faster rate than that laid down in Articles10 and 11, the same rate shall be applied for elimination of the charge vis-à-vis the Community.

Without prejudice to the provisions of Article 7, paragraph 2, the Contracting Parties shall eliminate as between themselves, not later than four years after the entry into force of this Protocol, all customs duties on exports and charges with equivalent effect.

1. The provisions of Article 7, paragraph 1 and of Articles8 to 15 inclusive
shall apply to customs duties of a fiscal nature.
2. The Community and Turkey shall notify to the Association Council, on the entry into force of this Protocol, their customs duties of a fiscal nature.
3. Turkey shall retain the right to replace these customs duties of a fiscal
nature by an internal charge in accordance with the provisions of Article 44.
4. If the Association Council finds that the replacement of a fiscal customs duty meets with serious difficulties in Turkey, it shall authorize the said country to retain this duty, provided Turkey abolishes it not later than the end of the transitional stage. The Authorization must be requested within twelve months as from tho entry into force of this Protocol.
Turkey may provisionally maintain the duties in question until a decision has been taken by the Association Council.

The alignment of the Turkish customs tariff with the common customs tariff shall be carried out during the transitional stage in the following manner, starting with the duties effectively applied by Turkey to third countries at the :date of signature of this Protocol.
1. In the case of products for which the duties effectively applied by Turkey on the above-mentioned date do not differ by more than 15 per cent in either direction from the duties under the common customs tariff, the latter duties shall be applied one year after the second reduction in customs duties referred to in Article 10.
2. In other cases Turkey shall apply, one year after the second reduction in customs duties referred to in Article 10, duties reducing by 20 per cent the difference between the rata effectively applied on the date of signature of this Protocol and that under the common customs tariff.
3. This difference shall be again reduced by 20 per cent. at the time of the fifth and seventh reductions of customs duties referred in Article 10.
4. The common customs tariff shall be applied in its entirety at the time of the tenth reduction of customs duties referred to in Article 10.

In dero.-ation of Article 17 and in respect of the products listed in
to a in the following manner:
Annex 3, Turkey shall prosedall. >. ..± during twenty-two year period,
1. With respect to products on which the duties effectively applied by Turkey at the date of signature of this Protocol do not differ by more than 15 pet cent in either direction from the duties under the common customs tariff, the latter duties shall be applied at the, time of the fourth reduction of duties referred to in Article 11.
2. In other cases, Turkey shall apply, at the time of the fourth reduction of
duties referred to in Article 11. duties reducing by 20 per cent the difference between the rate effectively applied on the day of signature of this Protocol and that in the common customs tariff.
3. This difference shall be again reduced by.30 and 20 per cent respectively. at the time of the seventh and ninth reductions referred to in Article 11.
4. The common customstarifff chall be applied in its entirety at the end of the twenty-second year.

1. In the case of a certain number of products representing not more than 10 per cent of the value of its total imports during 1967, and after consultation in the Association Council, Turkey shall be entitled to defer until the end of the twenty-second year following the entry into force of this Protocol the
reductions of its common duties vis-à-vis third countries which it should carry out under Articles 17 and 18.
2. In the case of a certain number of products representing not more than 5 per
cent of the value of its total imports in 1967, and after consultation in the Association Council, Turkey shall be entitled to maintain vis-à-vis third
countries, after a period of twenty-two years, customs duties higher than those under the common customs tariff.
3. Nevertheless, the application of the provisions set forth in tho preceding paragraphs shall not adversely affect the free movement of goods within the Association and shall not constitute grounds for action by Turkey under the provisions of Article 5.
4. In the event of the alignment of its customs tariff with the common customs tariff being accelerated, Turkey shall maintain for the benefit of the Community a preference equivalent to that resulting, from the machinery provided under the present chapter.
With respect to the products listed in Annex 3, no such acceleration may be effected before the end of the transitional stage except with the prior consent of the Association Council.
5. In the case of the customs duties covered by the authorization referred to in Article 16, paragraph 4, first sub-paragraph, or of those which Turkey is allowed to maintain temporarily in pursuance of Article 16, paragraph 4, second sub-paragraph, Turkey shall be exempted from applying the provisions of
Articles 17 and 18. On the expiry of the authorization it shall apply the duties which would follow from the application of these Articles.

1. In order to facilitate imports of certain products from countries with which
Turkey is linked by bilateral trade agreements, if the operation of. these agreements is substantially affected by the application of the provisions of this
Protocol or by measures taken in pursuance of this Procotol, Turkey shall be
entitled to grant tariff quotas at reduced rates of duty or duty free with the
prior consent of the Association Council.
2. Such consent shall be deemed to be granted when the tariff quotas referred
to in the preceding paragraph meet the following conditions:
(a) The total value of the quotas does not exceed annually 10 per cent of the .average value of Turkey' s imports from third countries during the three most recent years for which statistics are available, after deduction of imports effected with the resources referred to in Annex 4. This amount of 10 per cent shall be reduced by the. amount of' imports from third countries effected duty free under the provisions of Annex 4;
(b) for each product, the import value envisaged within the framework of the tariff quotas does not exceed one third of the average value of Turkey's imports of the product from third countries during the three most recent years for which statistics are available.
3. Turkey shall notify the Association Council of the measures it intends to take in accordance with the provisions of paragraph 2.
At the end of the transitional stage, the Association Council may decide whether the provisions of paragraph 2 should be abolished or amended.
4'. In no case may the duty under a tariff quota be less than the duty effectively applied by Turkey to imports coming from the Community.

chapter.name: Elimination Of Quantitative Restrictions As Between The Contracting Parties
chapter.article:
Quantitetivrerestrictions on imports and all measures with equivalent effect shall; without prejudice to the following provisions, be prohibited between the
Contracting Parties.

1. The Contracting Parties shall refrain, from introducing as between themselves new quantitative restrictions and measures with equivalent effect on imports.
2. Nevertheless, so far as Turkey is concerned, this obligation shall apply
upon the entry into force of this Protocol only to 35 per cent of its private imports from the Community in 1967. This percentage shall be raised to 40, 45, 60 and 80 per cent, three, eight, thirteen and eighteen years respectively after the entry into force of this Protocol.
3. Six months before each of the last three dates, the Association Council shall
examine the consequences of the increase in the liberalization rate on Turkey's economic development and shall decide, if necessary to ensure accelerated economic development for Turkey, to extend the time-imit by a period which it shall determine.
In the absence of such decision, the time-limit concerned shall be postponed by one year. The examination procedure shall be resumed six months before the end of that period. A second postponement of one year shall take place if again the Association Council does not take a decision.
At the end of this second period, the increase in the liberalization rate shall be applied by Turkey, failing a decision to the contrary by the Association Council.
4. The list of products liberalized for import from the Community into Turkey shall be notified to the Community at the time of signature of this Protocol. The list shall be bound vis-a-vis the Community. The lists of products liberalized on each of the dates referred to in paragraph 2 shall be notified to the Comnunity and bound in respect of it.
5. Turkey may reintroduce quantitative restrictions on imports of liberalized products that are not bound under this ALrticle, on condition that it opens quotas vis-A-vis the Community equal to at least 75 per cent of the average imports from the Comminity during the three most recent years preceding such reintroduction. These quotas shall be subject to the provisions of Article 25, paragraph 24.
6. In any case Turkey shall not apply to the Community treatment less favourable than to third countries.

The Contracting Parties shall, in their trade with one another, refrain from making more: restrictive the quantitative import restrictions and measures with equivalent effect existing on the date of entry into force of this Protocol, without prejudice to the provisions of particle 22, paragraph 5.
Upon the entry into force of this Protocol, the Community shall eliminate all quantitative restrictions on imports from Turkey. This liberalization shall be bound vis-a-vis Turkey.

1. Turkey shall progressively eliminate quantitative restrictions on imports from the Community subject to the conditions laid dowen in the following paragraphs.
2. One your after the entry into force of this Protocol, quotas for the benefit of the Community shall be opened for imports of each non-libera.ized product into Turkey. These quotas shall be fixed at an amount equal to average imports from the Community in the three most recent years for which statistics are available, a deduction being made in respect of imports effected.
(a) With special assistance resources earmarked for specified investment projects;
(b) without foreign exchange allocations
(c) within the context of the law to promote investments of foreign capital.
3. If the imports of a non-liberalized product from the Community during the first year following the entry into force of this Protocol fail to reach 7 per cent of total imports of this product, a quota aqual to 7 per cent of such imports shall be established one year after the entry into force of this Protocol.
4. Three years after the, entry into force of this Protocol, Turkey shall increase
tho total volume of quotas thus fixed so as to achieve, by comparison with the preceding year, an increase of at least 10 per cent of their total value and at least 5 per cent of the value of the quota for each product. Every two years these values shall be increased in the same proportion as compared with the preceding period.
5. Ais from the thirteenth year after the entry into force of this Protocol, each quota shall be increased by at least 20 per cent every two years as compared with the preceding period.
6. If, during the first year after the entry into force of this Protocol, there have been no imports into Turkey of a non-liberalized product, the procedures for opening and augmenting a quota shall be determined by the Association Council.
7. If the Association Council finds that imports of a non-liberalized product during two consecutive years have been appreciably less than the quota opened, such quota may iot be taken into consideration in computing the total value of the quotas. In such case, Turkey shall abolish quota restrictions on such product imported from the Community.
8. All quantitative restrictions on imports into Turkey must be abolished not later than twenty-two years as from the entry into force of this Protocol.

1. The Contracting Parties shall abolish as between themselves all measures with equivalent effect to quantitative import restrictions not later than the end of a twenty-two year period. The association Council shall recommend the gradual adjustments to be made during this period, taking into account the arrangements made within the Community.
2. In particular,. Turkey shall progressively eliminate the deposits which importers are required to lodge in respect of imports of goods from the Community, in accordance with the schedule provided for in Articles 10 and 11.
In addition the deposits in an amount exceeding 140 per cent of the customs value of goods imported from the Community, in respect of parts and accessories for motor vehicles falling within heading No. 87.06 of the Turkish customs tariff, and in an amount exceeding 120 per cent of that same value in respect 'of other products, shall be reduced to the levels indicated above as from the entry into force of this Protocol.

1. Quantitative restrictions on exports and any measures with equivalent effect
shall be prohibited as between the Contracting Parties.
The Community and Turkey shall abolish as between themselves, not later than
the end of the transitional stage, the quantitative restrictions on exports and any measures having equivalent effect.
2. In derogation of the foregoing paragraph the Community and Turkey, after consultation in the Association Council, may maintain or introduce restrictions on exports of basic products, to the extent necessary to encourage the development of certain activities of their economy or to cope with any shortage of such products.
In such. case the Party concerned shall open in favour of the other Party a quota which shall take account, on the one hand, of average exports for the three most recent years for which statistics are available, and on the other hand of the
normal development of trade resulting from the progressive attainment of the
customs union.

Turkey declares its readiness to remove, in respect of the Community, its quantitative restrictions on imports and exports at a faster rate than that laid down in the foregoing Articles, if its general economic situation and the situation of the sector concerned permit it to do so. The associationn Council shall make recommendations to Turkey to this end.

The provisions of Articles 21 to 27 inclusive shall not prevent prohibitions or restrictions being imposed on imports, exports or transit on the grounds of public morality, public order, public security, protection of human or animal life or health, the preservation of plant life, the protection of national treasures of artistic, historical or archaeological value or the protection of industrial
and commercial property. Such prohibitions or restrictions shall not, however, constitute either a means of arbitrary discrimination or a disguised restriction on trade between the Contracting Parties.

1. The Contracting Parties shall progressively adapt the State monopolies of a
commercial character in such a way as to ensure the exclusion, onthe expiryof a period of twenty-two years, of all discrimination in conditions relating to supplies and outlets, as between the nationals of member States of the Community end of Turkey.
The provisions of this Article shall apply to any organization by means of
which a member State or Turkey shall, de jure or de facto; either directly or indirectly, control, direct or appreciably influence imports or exports as between the Community and Turkey. These provisions shall also apply to monopolies assigned
by the State.
2. The Contracting Parties shall abstain from any new measure which contravenes the principles laid down in paragraph 1 or which limits the scope of the articles concerning the elimination of customs duties and quantitative restrictions between
them.
3. The procedures and the timing according to which the Turkish monopolies
referred to in this Article are to be adapted and the barriers to trade between
the Community and Turkey reduced, shall, be laid down by the Association Council
not later than six years after the entry into force of this Protocol.
Pending the decision of the Association Council referred to in the preceding paragraph, the Contracting Parties shall apply to products which are the subject of a monopoly in the other Contracting Party treatment no less favourable than that applied to the same products of the most-favoured third country.
4. The obligations incumbent on the Contracting Parties shall be binding only in as far as they are compatible with existing international agreements.

chapter.name: Products Subject On Importation Into The Community To Specific Regulations Following The Bringing Into Operation Of The Common Agricultural Policy
chapter.article:
The system laid down, in Chapter IV for agricultural products shall be
applicable to products subject on importation into the Community to specific
regulations following the bringing into operation of the common agricultural policy.

chapter.name: Agriculture
chapter.article: The provisions of this Protocol shall apply to agricultural products, save as otherwise provided in Articles 33 to 35.

l. During a period of twenty-two years, Turkey shall adjust its agricultural policy, with a view to adopting, at the end of that period, those measures of the common agricultural policy whose application in Turkey is indispensable for the
establishment of the free movement of agricultural products as between the Community and Turkey.
2. During the period referred to in paragraph 1, the Community shall, when establishing or further developing its agricultural policy, have regard to the interests of Turkish agriculture. Turkey shall transmit to the Community any
information required for that purpose.
3. The Community shall notify Turkey of the Commission's proposals on the
establishment or development of the common agricultural policy and also of the opinions and decisions adopted concerning these proposals.
4. The Association Council shall decide on the communications to be made in the
agricultural sphere by Turkey to the Community.
5. At Association Council level, consultations may be held on the Commission's
proposals refe-rred to in paragraph 3 -.:.nd on the measures which Turkey intends to adopt in the agricultural sphere pursuant to paragraph 1.

1. At the end of the period of twenty-two years, the Association Council, after finding that Turkey has adopted the common agricultural policy measures referred to in Article 33, paragraph 1, shall lay down the provisions required to ensure the free movement of agricultural products as between the Community and Turkeys
2. The provisions referred to in paragraph 1 may comprise any necessary derogation from the rules laid down by this Protocol.
3. The Association Council may change the date referred to in paragraph 1.

1. Pending the issue of the provisions referred to in Article 34 and in derogation of Articles 7 to 11, 15 to 18, 19, paragraphs 1 and 5, 21 to 27, and 30, the Community and Turkey shall accord one another, for their trade in agricultural products, a preferential regime the scope and details of which shall be determined
by the Association Council.
2. However, the régime applicable from the beginning of the transitional stage is
laid down in Annex: No. 6.
3. One year after the entry into force of this Protocol and subsequently every
two years, the Association Council shall, at the request. of one of the two Parties, review the results of the preferential régime applicable to agricultural products. It may decide on the improvements which may prove necessary in order to ensure the
progressive achievement of the objectives of the Association Agreement.
4. The provisions of Article 34 paragraph 2 shall apply. MOVEMENT OF PERSONS AND SERVICES

chapter.name: The Workers
chapter.article:
The free movement of workers beteen the States Members of the Community and Turkey shall be achieved gradually in conformity with the principles laid down
in Article 12 of the Association Agreement, between the end of the twelfth and of the twenty second year after the entry into force of the said Agreement.
The Association Council shall decide on the procedures to be laid down for this purpose.

Each Member State shall accord to workers of Turkish nationality employed in the Community a régime characterized by the absence of any discrimination based on nationality in relation to workers nationals of other States Members of the Community as regards working conditions and remuneration.

Pending the gradual achievement of the free movement of workers as between the
StatesMembers of the Community and Turkey, the Association Council may examine all questions raised by the geographical and occupational mobility of workers of
Turkish nationality, including more particularly the renewal of work and residence permits, with a view to facilitating the employment of such workers in each Member
State.
To that end, the Association Council may make recommendations to Member States.

1. Before the end of the first year after the entry into force of this Protocol, the Association Council shall lay down social security provisions for workers of Turkish nationality moving within the Community and for their families resident in the Community.
2. These provisions shall enable workers of Turkish nationality, on conditions to be laid down, to have taken into account all periods of insurance or employment in the various Member States as regards pension and old-age, death and disability benefits and also medical care of workers and their families residing in the Community. These provisions shall not establish an obligation for States Members of the Community to take into account periods of insurance or employment in Turkey.
3. The provisions referred to above must be such as to ensure payment of family allowances where the worker's family resides in the Community.
4. Pension and old-age, death and disability benefits obtained by virtue of the
provisions laid down in pursuance of paragraph 2 shall be transferable to Turkey.
5. The provisions of this Article shall not affect the rights and obligations deriving from existing bilateral agreements between Turkey and States Members of the Community, where such agreements provide a more favourable regime for Turkish nationals.

The Association Council may make recommendations to Member States and to Turkey in order to promote exchanges of young workers on the basis of the methods adopted by Member States in application of Article 50 of the Treaty establishing the Community.

chapter.name: Right Of Establishment Services And Transport
chapter.article:
1. The Contracting Parties shall refrain from introducing as between themselves new restrictions on the freedom of establishment and the free supply of services.
2. The Association Council shall, in accordance with the principles laid down in Articles 13 and 14 of the Association Agreement, determine the rate at which and the conditions under which, the Contracting Parties shall progressively abolish as between them any restrictions on the freedom of establishment and the free supply
of services.
The Association Council shall determine this rate and these conditions for the various categories of activity, having regard to the analagous arrangements already made by the Community in these matters and also the special economic and social situation of Turkey. Priority shall be accorded to activities contributing more particularly to the development of production and trade.

1. The Association Council shall, on conditions to be laid down by it, having regard in particular to the geographical situation of Turkey, extend to Turkey the clauses dealing with transport in the Treaty establishing the Community. It
may, on the same conditions, extend to Turkey the action taken by the Community in application of these clauses to rail, road and waterway Transport.
2. If the Community, in pursuance of Article 84, paragraph 2, of the Treaty
establishing the Cormunity, adopts provisions concerning maritime and air transport,
the Association Council shall decide whether, to what extent., and by what procedure regulations may be enacted for Turkish maritimie and air transport. APPROXIMATION OF ECONOMIC POLICIES

chapter.name: Competition, Fiscal Regulations And Approximation Of Laws
chapter.article:
1. The Association Council shall, within six years from the entry into force of this Protocol, lay down the conditions and procedures governing the application of the principles referred to in Articles 85, 86, 90 and 92 of the Treaty establishing
the Community.
2. During the transitional period, Turkey may be deemed to be in the situation referred to in Article 92, paragraph 3(a) of the Treaty establishing the Community. Aids designed to promote Turkey's economic development shall therefore, to the exten to which they do not affect trading conditions to a degree contrary to the common interest of the Contracting Parties, be deemed compatible with the proper functioning
of the Association.
At the end of the transitional stage, the Association Council shall, with due regard to the economic situation of Turkey at that date, decide whether it is necessary to extend the operation of the provisions of the preceding sub-paragraph,

1. A Contracting Party shall not impose, directly or indirectly, on the products
of the other Contracting Party, any internal charges of any kind whatsoever in excess of those directly or indirectly imposed on like domestic products.
A Contracting Party shall not impose on the products of the other Contracting Party internal charges such as would afford indirect protection to other productions
The Contracting Parties shall, not later than the beginning of the third year after the entry into force of this Protocol, eliminate the provisions that exist on the date of the signature thereof which are at variance with the above rules.
2. In trade between the Community and Turkey, products exported may not benefit from any drawback of internal charges in excess of the charges :imposed directly or indirectly on them.
3. Where a turnover tax calculated by a cumulative multi-stage system is levied,
average rates for specific products or groups of products may be fixed for the internal charges imposed on imported products or for the drawbacks accorded on
exported products, provided they do not infringe the principles laid down in the preceding paragraphs.
4. The Association Council shall supervise the application of the foregoing provisions, due allowance being made for the experience acquired by the Community in the sphere covered by this Article.

With regard to charges other than turnover tax, excise duties and other indirect taxes, exemptions and drawbacks in respect of exports may not be operated. and countervailing charges in respect of imports may not be imposed in the trade between the Community and Turkey, except in so far as the measures contemplated have been previously approved for a limited period by the Association Council.

The Contracting Parties may takethe safeguard measures they deem necessary to romedy the difficulties arising either from the absence, of an association Council decision laying down the implementing conditions and procedures referred to in Article 43, paragraph 1, or from failure to apply these decisions or the provisions of Articles 44 and 45.

1. If, in the course of a twenty-two year period, the Association Council, at the request of one of the Contracting Parties, finds that dumping practices are being operated in relations between the Community and Turkey, it shall issue
recommendations to the originator or originators of such practices with a view to bringing them to an end.
2. The Party affected may, after duly notifying the Association Council, take the relevant protective measures in cases where:
(a) the Association Council has taken no decision under paragraph 1 within three months from the submission of the application;
(b) notwithstanding the issue of the recommendations referred to in paragraph 1, the dumping practices are continued.
Moreover, where the interests of the affected Party require immediate action, that Party may, after duly informing the Association Council, take provisional protective measures, including the imposition of anti-dumping duties in orddr to safeguard its interests. The duration of such measures may not exceed three months from the submission of the application or from the date on which the Party affected has taken protective measures under sub-paragraph (b) above.
3. Where protective measures have been taken in the cases referred to in paragraph 2, first sub-paragraph (a) or second subparagraph the Association Council may at any time decide that such protective .measures shall be suspended pending the issue of the recommendations referred to in paragraph 1.
Where protective measures have been taken in the case referred to in paragraph 2, first sub-paragraph (b), the Association Council may recommend the abrogation or modification of such protective Measures.
4. Products originating from one of the Contracting Parties, or which have
been given free pratique and have been exported to the other Contracting Party,
shall be admitted, when re-imported into the territory of the former Party, free
of all customs duties, quantitative restrictions or measures with equivalent
effect.
The Association Council may issue any recommendations required for the application of the provisions of this paragraph in the light of the experience which the Community has
acquired in this field.

In the sectors not covered by the provisions of this Protocol which have a direct bearing on the functioning of the Association, or in sectors covered by such provisions where the latter do not lay down any specific procedure, the
Association Council may recommend each of the Contracting Parties to take steps which will conduce to an approximation of their laws, regulations or administrative
provisions.

chapter.name: Economic Policy
chapter.article:
With a view to promoting, the achievement of
objectivesreffered to in
Article 17 of the association Agrement, the Contracting Parties shall hold regular, consultations with one another in the Association Council in order to
co-ordinate, their respective economic policies.
The Association Council shall, where necessary, recommend the measures appropriate in the circumstances.

1. The Contracting Parties declare their readiness to liberalize theirpayments beyond the extent provided for in Article 19of the Association Agreement, in so far as their economic situation in general and the state of their balance of payments in particular so permit.
2. To the extent that exchangesof goods and services and movements of capital
are limited only by restrictions on the payments therewith connected, the provisions regarding elimination of quantitative restrictions, supply of services
and movements of capital shall, for the purposes of the gradual abolition of such
restrictions, apply mutatis mutandis.
3. The Contracting Parties undertake not to make the regulations they apply to transfers connected with the invisible transactions listed in Annex III of the Treaty establishing the Community more restrictive, save with the prior consent
of the Association Council.
4. The Contracting Parties shall, if necessary, agree together on the steps to be taken to enable the payments and transfers referred to in Article 19 of the
Association Agreement and in this Article to be effected.

the of the Association Agreement, Turkey shall, after the entry into force of this Protocol, endeavour to improve, the conditions accorded to private capital from the Communitywhere such capital can contribute to Turkey's economic development.
Withaview toachievement of the objectives referred to in Article 20

The Contiacting Parties shall endeavour to introduce no further exchange restriction on capital movements between them or on current payments connected with such movements and not to make the existing system more restrictive.
The Contracting Parties shall, to the fullest extent possible, simplify the permit and control formalities applicable to the conclusion or execution of capital transactions and transfers and, whore necessary, shall take joint action towards such simplification.

chapter.name: Commercial Policy
chapter.article:
1. The Contracting Parties shall take concerted action in the Association
Council to ensure, during the transitional stage, co-ordination of their trade
policies towards third counties, more particularly in the matters covered by
Article 113, paragraph 1, of the Treaty establishing the Community.
In this connexion, each Contracting Party shall, if requested by the other Party, supply any information needed about the agreements embodying tariff or commercial provisions concluded by it, and also about the changes it makes in its foreign trade arrangements.
Should such changes or such agreements have a direct and special bearing on the functioning of the Assoociation, adequate consultations shall be held in the Association Council in order to make provision for the interests of the Contracting
Parties.
2. On the expiry of the transitional stage, the Contracting Parties shall, strengthen the co-ordination of their trade policies in the Association Council in order to achieve a trade policy based on uniform principles.

1. If the Community concludes an association agreement or a preferential agreement havingg a direct and particular bearing on the functioning of the Association; adequate consultations shall be held in the Association Council., in order to enable the Community to take into consideration the mutual interests defined by the Agreement of Association between tho Community and Turkey.
2. Turkey shall, wherever this may be found necessary to avoid obstacles to the movement of goods within the Association, endeavour to take all steps required in order to promote a solution of the practical problems which might arise out of
its trade with countries connected with the Community by an association agreement or a preferential arrangement.
If such stops have not been taken, the Association Council may lay down the provisions required to ensure the proper functioning of the Association.

Consultations shall be hold in the Association Council on the application of "Regional Co-operation for Development (R.C.D.)". The Association Council may, if necessary decide on the arrangements
required. Those arrangements must not impede the proper functioning of the Association.

In the event of the accession of a third State to the Community, adequate
consultations shall be hold in the Association Council to ensure that provision is made for tho mutual interests of the Community and of Turkey, as defined by the Association Agreement.

chapter.name: General And Final Provisions
chapter.article:
The Contracting Parties shall progressively adapt the conditions for participation in contracts concluded by public administrations or public under
takings, and also by private undertakings to which special or exclusive rights are granted, so as to eliminate, by the end of any
a period of twenty-two years,
discrimination between nationals of Member States and nationals of Turkey resident
in the territory of the Contracting Parties. The Association Council shall establish the time-table and the procedures for such adaptation in the light of the solutions adopted in this matter in the Community.

In the matters covered by this Protocol: the régime applied by Turkey to the Community maynot result in any
discrimination between the Member States, their nationals or their companies; the régime applied by the Community to Turkey may not result in any
discirimination between Turkish nationals or companies.

In the matters covered by this Protocol, Turkey may not enjoy more favourable
treatment that that accorded by the Member States to each other pursuant to the Treaty establishing the Community.

1. If serious disturbances occur in a sector of Turkey's economic activity on threaten its externalfinancial stability, or if difficulties arise that have the affect of altering the economic situation of any of its areas, Turkey may take the necessary safeguard measures.
Those measures and their implementing medalities shall be notified without delay to the Association Council.
2. If serious disturbances occurin a sector of the economic activity of the Community or of one or more of the Member State, or threaten the external financial stability of one or more Member States, or if difficulties arise that have the effect, of altering the economic situation of any area of the Community, the latter may take, or authorize the Member State or States concerned to take, the necessary safeguard measures.
These measures and their implementing modalities shall be notified without delay to the Association Council.
3. For the implementation of the provisions of paragraphs 1 and 2, preference shall be given to those measures causing the least possible disturbance in the functioning of the Association. These measures must not exceed what is strictly necessary to remedy the difficulties which have arisen.
4. Consultations may take place in the Association Council on measures taken in pursuance of paragraphs 1 and 2.
The duration of the transitional stage shall be twelve years, subject to the special provisions of this Protocol.
This Protocol and its Annexes shall forman integral part of the Agreement creating an Association between the European Economic Community and Turkey.

1. This Protocol shall be ratified by the signatory States in accordance with the rules oftheir respective constitutions and shall be validly concluded, as far as the Communityconcerned, by a Council decision taken in accordance with
is the provisions of the Treaty establishing the Community and notified to the Contracting Parties to the Agreement creating an Association between the European Economic Community and Turkey.
The instruments of ratification and the notice of conclusion referred to above shall be exchanged at Brussels.
2. This Protocol shallcome into force on the first day of the month following the date of exchange of the instruments of ratification and the notice of conclusion referred to in paragraph 1.
3. If the entry into force of this Protocol does not coincide with the beginning of the civil year, the Association Council may reduce or extend the time-limits laid down in this Protocol, more particularly for the achievement of
the free movement of goods, so as to make those time-limitsexpire at the end of the civil year.
This Protocol is drawn up in duplicated in German, French, Italian, Dutch and Turkish, each text being equally authentic.

chapter.name: Conclusion
chapter.article:
IN FAITH WHEREOF the undersigned plenipotentiaries have attached their
signatures to this Additional Protocol.
Done at Brussels, on the twenty-third day of November one thousand nine hundred and seventy
For His Majesty the King of the Belgians, PierreHARMEL
For the President of the Federal public of Germany, Walter SCHEEL
For the President of the French Republic,
For the President of the Italian Republic, Mario PEDINI
For His Royal Highness the Grand Duke of Luxembourg, Gaston
THORN
For Her Majesty theQueen of the Netherlands,
J.M.A.H. LUMS
For the Council of the European Communities, Walter SCHEEL FRANCEMaria MALFATTI
For the President of the Turkish Republic, Ihsan Sabr CAGLAYANGIL
